title: How Many Calories Do I Burn in Pilates?
meta_description: Discover how many calories do I burn in Pilates per hour, based on weight and intensity, with estimates for a standard session and variations.
h1: How Many Calories Do I Burn in Pilates?
assumptions: 60-minute moderate-intensity Pilates class for a 150 lb (68 kg) person; reformer or mat-based; no high-impact elements.
disclaimer: Calories burned vary by body weight, fitness level, intensity, class type, and duration. Use a fitness tracker for personalized estimates.

quick_answer.text: A 1-hour moderate Pilates session burns about 250 calories for an average adult.

label_note: Values represent estimated energy expenditure; other fields are not applicable to calorie burn data.

tweaks.label: For a 200 lb (91 kg) person vs. 150 lb basis

faqs.q: How many calories do I burn in Pilates per hour?
faqs.a: About 200-300 calories for moderate intensity, depending on weight and effort.

faqs.q: Does weight affect calories burned in Pilates?
faqs.a: Yes—heavier individuals burn more; e.g., 150 lb burns ~250 kcal/hour, 200 lb ~330 kcal/hour.

faqs.q: Is Pilates good for calorie burning compared to other exercises?
faqs.a: Moderate; burns less than running (~600 kcal/hour) but more than yoga (~200 kcal/hour) for similar duration.

faqs.q: How to calculate personal calories burned in Pilates?
faqs.a: Use MET value (3-6 for Pilates) × weight in kg × hours; or apps like MyFitnessPal.

faqs.q: What factors increase calories burned in Pilates?
faqs.a: Higher intensity, longer sessions, added resistance (e.g., reformer), and individual fitness level.
